page.title: 17THE ROUNDHOUSE, CHALFORD
page.content: The Roundhouse was built in 1789 at the opening of the Thames and Severn Canal.The lock keeper and his family lived there.His job was to look after the lengths,or pounds,of waterway. They also had to operate the lock gates each time a barge passed east or west.The Roundhouse is shaped like its name and is four storeys high,built from Cotswold stone with a roof of slates in a conical shape.Originally it only had two small rooms.After the First World War it was lived in by a lockeeper,his wife and their ten children. For a short time it was a museum but it is now a private house. The area of the canal in front of the building has been restored recently.It is a picturesque reminder of the history of our valley.
